title: How to Carve Shrunken Head Apples

steps.headline: Thoroughly wash the apple with water.
Soak the apple in a mixture of lemon juice and salt (1 cup of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of salt) for about 15-30 minutes.
steps.description: This will keep the apple from turning dark.

steps.headline: Carve the face as desired, exaggerating the features.Draw the face first with water based markers.
steps.description: Do not worry too much about it because as the apple dries, your "mistakes" will shrink. Plus, apples are delicious, and so  "failed" carvings can be eaten on the spot.

steps.headline: Dip your "finished" face in the lemon juice mixture again.
Place the apple in a food dehydrator or in a warm, dry, well ventilated place.
steps.description: You can insert a wire into the apple to hang it, pierce the center with a long skewer and put it in a vase, or place it on a rack. Make sure air reaches the entire surface of the apple so that it dries evenly. See Warnings.

steps.headline: Turn the apple over every 12 hours or so until dry.

text:
Thoroughly wash the apple with water. Peel the apple. Core the apple. Soak the apple in a mixture of lemon juice and salt (1 cup of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of salt) for about 15-30 minutes. This will keep the apple from turning dark. Carve the face as desired, exaggerating the features.Draw the face first with water based markers. Do not worry too much about it because as the apple dries, your "mistakes" will shrink. Plus, apples are delicious, and so "failed" carvings can be eaten on the spot. Dip your "finished" face in the lemon juice mixture again. Place the apple in a food dehydrator or in a warm, dry, well ventilated place. You can insert a wire into the apple to hang it, pierce the center with a long skewer and put it in a vase, or place it on a rack. Make sure air reaches the entire surface of the apple so that it dries evenly. See Warnings. Turn the apple over every 12 hours or so until dry. It'll feel "spongy" when it's done. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/A7_831.JPG/460px-A7_831.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4b/A7_831.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570.6188925081433,"licensing":"

sentences: Thoroughly wash the apple with water.
Soak the apple in a mixture of lemon juice and salt (1 cup of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of salt) for about 15-30 minutes.
This will keep the apple from turning dark.
Carve the face as desired, exaggerating the features.Draw the face first with water based markers.
Do not worry too much about it because as the apple dries, your "mistakes" will shrink.
Plus, apples are delicious, and so  "failed" carvings can be eaten on the spot.
Dip your "finished" face in the lemon juice mixture again.
Place the apple in a food dehydrator or in a warm, dry, well ventilated place.
You can insert a wire into the apple to hang it, pierce the center with a long skewer and put it in a vase, or place it on a rack.
Make sure air reaches the entire surface of the apple so that it dries evenly.
Turn the apple over every 12 hours or so until dry.

tyn_section: Apple corer (paring knife and spoon may also be used)
